criteria.title: Header & Navigation
criteria.gpt_instructions: Evaluate the Header component implementation. Check for: 1) Sticky navigation using useEffect with scroll listener, 2) Dropdown menu functionality on hover with at least 4 menu categories, 3) Dark/Light mode toggle implementation with localStorage persistence, 4) Quick navigation links to Home, Signature Dishes, Reservation Form, Chatbot, and Footer sections. Assess code quality, proper use of React hooks, and implementation completeness. Look for smooth transitions and proper state management.
sub_criteria: Dropdown menu on 'Menu' hover with at least 4 categories
Dark/Light mode toggle with localStorage persistence
Quick links to Home, Signature Dishes, Reservation Form, Chatbot, Footer

levels.Excellent: All 4 sub-criteria fully implemented with smooth functionality. Sticky nav uses useEffect correctly, dropdown shows 4+ categories on hover, dark/light mode persists in localStorage, and all quick links navigate properly. Code is clean and well-organized.
levels.Good: 3 out of 4 sub-criteria work well. Minor issues in one area such as sticky behavior timing, dropdown styling, theme persistence, or one broken navigation link.
levels.Fair: 2 out of 4 sub-criteria functional. Notable issues such as missing useEffect implementation, incomplete dropdown, theme not persisting, or multiple broken links.
levels.Poor: Only 1 or none of the sub-criteria work. Header is static, no dropdown menu, no theme toggle, or navigation links are broken.

criteria.title: Hero Section (Carousel)
criteria.gpt_instructions: Assess the Hero section carousel implementation. Verify: 1) Full-width carousel with high-quality images, 2) Autoplay slider functionality using JavaScript/React state, 3) Typewriter animation effect for restaurant name, 4) Smooth transition effects between slides. Evaluate visual appeal, animation smoothness, timing intervals, and overall user experience. Check if images are properly displayed and transitions are visually pleasing.

levels.Excellent: All 4 features implemented excellently. Carousel is full-width with quality images, autoplay works smoothly, typewriter effect is present and visually appealing, and transitions are seamless. Professional presentation.
levels.Good: 3 out of 4 features work well. Minor issues such as autoplay timing, typewriter speed, or transition smoothness. Overall good user experience.
levels.Fair: 2 out of 4 features present. Carousel may not be full-width, autoplay broken, typewriter missing, or transitions are abrupt/jarring.
levels.Poor: Only 1 or none of the features work. Static hero section, no carousel functionality, no animations, or broken implementation.

criteria.title: Signature Dishes Section
criteria.gpt_instructions: Evaluate the Signature Dishes section implementation. Check for: 1) Dynamic loading of dishes from /data/ file, 2) Display of first 3 dishes by default with functional 'Load More' button, 3) Filter buttons by category (Veg, Non-Veg, Chef Specials), 4) Hover tooltip showing description and price, 5) Smooth state transitions when filtering or loading more dishes. Assess data structure, state management, component organization, and user interaction smoothness.
sub_criteria: Display first 3 dishes by default with a 'Load More' button
Filter buttons by category (Veg, Non-Veg, Chef Specials)
Hover tooltip with description and price
Smooth state transitions on filter/load more

levels.Excellent: All 5 features fully functional. Dishes load dynamically from data file, shows 3 initially with working 'Load More', all filter categories work, hover tooltips display properly, and transitions are smooth. Excellent state management.
levels.Good: 4 out of 5 features work well. Minor issues such as tooltip styling, filter transition smoothness, or load more button behavior. Data flows correctly.
levels.Fair: 3 out of 5 features functional. Notable issues like hardcoded data instead of dynamic loading, missing filters, broken tooltips, or no load more functionality.
levels.Poor: 2 or fewer features work. Dishes are hardcoded, no dynamic loading, no filtering, no tooltips, or major state management issues.

criteria.title: Menu Pages (React Router)
criteria.gpt_instructions: Assess React Router implementation for menu pages. Verify: 1) Dynamic routing for menu categories (e.g., /menu/starters, /starters, /maindishes, /drinks, /desserts), 2) Pages correctly map over data arrays, 3) Category filtering works on individual pages, 4) Seamless navigation using React Router DOM without page reloads, 5) Clean URL structure. Check for proper Route configuration, component props, and navigation patterns.
sub_criteria: Pages map over data array correctly
Seamless navigation using React Router DOM

levels.Excellent: All 5 routing features implemented perfectly. Dynamic routes work for all categories, pages map data correctly, filtering functions on each page, navigation is seamless, and URLs are clean and intuitive.
levels.Good: 4 out of 5 features work well. Minor routing issues, slight data mapping problems, or inconsistent URL patterns. Overall good navigation experience.
levels.Fair: 3 out of 5 features functional. Routes may be hardcoded, data mapping incomplete, filtering broken on some pages, or URL structure inconsistent.
levels.Poor: 2 or fewer features work. No dynamic routing, pages don't map data, no filtering, navigation causes page reloads, or broken URL structure.

criteria.title: Reservation Form
criteria.gpt_instructions: Evaluate the Reservation Form implementation. Check for: 1) All required fields present (Name, Email, Phone, Guests, Date/Time picker), 2) Form validation including empty field checks and email regex validation, 3) Character counter for message textarea, 4) Reservations properly saved to localStorage, 5) Success message displayed on submit. Assess validation logic, error handling, user feedback, localStorage implementation, and overall form UX.
sub_criteria: All fields present: Name, Email, Phone, Guests, Date/Time picker

levels.Excellent: All 5 form features fully implemented. All fields present and functional, robust validation with regex for email, character counter works, localStorage saves reservations properly, and success message displays. Excellent UX.
levels.Good: 4 out of 5 features work well. Minor validation issues, character counter styling, localStorage edge cases, or success message timing. Form is functional.
levels.Fair: 3 out of 5 features present. Missing fields, weak validation, no character counter, localStorage not working, or no success feedback.
levels.Poor: 2 or fewer features work. Form is incomplete, no validation, doesn't save data, or is non-functional.

criteria.title: Chatbot Section
criteria.gpt_instructions: Assess the Chatbot implementation. Verify: 1) Floating button that opens chatbot interface, 2) Scrollable chat area with distinct bot and user message styling, 3) Placeholder or loading state showing 'Bot is typing…' or similar feedback. Evaluate UI design, modal behavior, message display, and user interaction flow. Check if chatbot provides good UX and visual feedback.
sub_criteria: Scrollable chat area with bot/user messages

levels.Excellent: All 3 chatbot features work perfectly. Floating button is accessible and opens chat, scrollable area displays messages with clear bot/user distinction, loading state provides good feedback. Professional implementation.
levels.Good: All features present with minor issues. Floating button works but positioning could be better, chat area functional but styling basic, loading state present but simple.
levels.Fair: 2 out of 3 features work. Chat opens but not with floating button, messages display but without clear distinction, or no loading state.
levels.Poor: 1 or no features work. No chatbot interface, button doesn't work, or chatbot is non-functional.

criteria.title: Footer
criteria.gpt_instructions: Evaluate the Footer component. Check for: 1) Dynamic opening hours logic that shows 'We're Open' or 'We're Closed' based on current time, 2) Social media icons that are properly linked, 3) Contact information displayed clearly, 4) Clean design consistent with overall site theme. Assess JavaScript logic for time-based status, link functionality, information completeness, and design cohesion.
sub_criteria: Dynamic opening hours logic shows 'We're Open/Closed'

levels.Excellent: All 4 footer features implemented excellently. Opening hours logic works dynamically, social icons link correctly, contact info is complete and clear, design is polished and consistent with site theme.
levels.Good: 3 out of 4 features work well. Minor issues such as opening hours timing logic, one broken social link, incomplete contact info, or slight design inconsistencies.
levels.Fair: 2 out of 4 features present. Static hours (no dynamic logic), social icons not linked, missing contact info, or poor design integration.
levels.Poor: 1 or no features work. No footer, no opening hours, no social links, missing contact info, or extremely poor design.

criteria.title: JavaScript Functionality
criteria.gpt_instructions: Conduct a comprehensive evaluation of all JavaScript functionality across the application. Assess implementation quality and functionality of: 1) Sticky Navbar with scroll behavior, 2) Dropdown Menu hover interactions, 3) Dark/Light Toggle with state persistence, 4) Carousel Autoplay mechanism, 5) Typewriter Animation effect, 6) Load More Dishes functionality, 7) Filter by Category feature, 8) Form Validation including regex and character counter, 9) Save to localStorage for reservations and theme, 10) Dynamic Open/Closed Logic based on time. Evaluate code quality, proper use of React hooks, state management, event handlers, and overall JavaScript proficiency. Each feature represents 1 point.

levels.Excellent: 9-10 features fully functional with clean, well-organized code. Excellent use of React hooks, proper state management, efficient event handling, and demonstrates strong JavaScript proficiency. All interactions are smooth and bug-free.
levels.Good: 7-8 features working well. Minor bugs or code quality issues in 1-2 areas. Good JavaScript implementation with proper React patterns. Most functionality works as expected.
levels.Fair: 5-6 features functional. Notable issues in multiple areas such as broken event handlers, poor state management, incomplete features, or buggy implementations. Basic JavaScript competency demonstrated.
levels.Poor: 4 or fewer features work. Major functionality broken, poor code quality, improper use of React hooks, or demonstrates limited JavaScript understanding. Multiple critical features missing or non-functional.

criteria.title: Responsiveness
criteria.gpt_instructions: Evaluate responsive design implementation across all devices. Check for: 1) Fully responsive layouts across desktop, tablet, and mobile viewports, 2) Navigation bar and dropdown menu adapt properly for mobile (hamburger menu, vertical layout), 3) Images and carousel scale appropriately without breaking layouts, 4) Touch-friendly UI elements (proper button sizes, adequate spacing). Review Tailwind CSS responsive classes usage (sm:, md:, lg:, xl:), media queries, flexbox/grid implementations, and mobile-first design approach. Assess if the site provides excellent UX on all screen sizes.
sub_criteria: Fully responsive across devices (desktop, tablet, mobile)
Nav bar and dropdown adapt for mobile

levels.Excellent: Fully responsive across all devices. Navigation perfectly adapts to mobile with hamburger menu or appropriate alternative, images and carousel scale beautifully, all UI elements are touch-friendly. Demonstrates excellent responsive design with proper Tailwind classes and mobile-first approach.
levels.Good: Good responsiveness across devices with minor issues. Mobile navigation works but could be more polished, images scale well with occasional layout shifts, most UI elements are touch-friendly. Solid responsive implementation.
levels.Fair: Basic responsive behavior but with notable issues. Mobile navigation is cramped or difficult to use, images don't scale properly causing horizontal scroll, some UI elements too small for touch interaction. Limited responsive design skills shown.
levels.Poor: Not responsive or severely broken on mobile devices. Navigation unusable on mobile, images overflow containers, layout completely breaks on small screens, or site is desktop-only. No evidence of responsive design consideration.

criteria.title: Git & GitHub
criteria.gpt_instructions: Evaluate Git version control practices and documentation. Assess: 1) Commit history with clear, semantic commit messages following conventions (e.g., 'feat:', 'fix:', 'docs:'), 2) Proper branching strategy with evidence of dev/feature branches and pull requests, 3) Complete README.md containing team roles/members, features list, tech stack explanation, and live deployment link. Check commit frequency, message quality, branch organization, and README completeness. Look for professional development workflow practices.
sub_criteria: Proper branching strategy (dev, feature branches, PRs)
Complete README.md with team roles, features, tech stack, and live link

levels.Excellent: All 3 criteria met excellently. Consistent semantic commits with clear messages, proper branching strategy with feature branches and PRs, comprehensive README with all required information. Demonstrates professional Git workflow.
levels.Good: Good Git practices with minor gaps. Regular commits with mostly clear messages, some branching strategy used, good README with most information present. Solid version control understanding.
levels.Fair: Basic Git usage but with issues. Infrequent or unclear commits, limited branching (mostly main branch), basic README missing some key information. Shows basic version control knowledge.
levels.Poor: Poor Git practices. Few commits with unclear messages, no branching strategy, incomplete or missing README. Demonstrates minimal Git understanding or usage.

criteria.title: Deployment
criteria.gpt_instructions: This criterion is evaluated by testing the deployed application URL from DEPLOYMENT_URL.txt file.
sub_criteria: Site accessible via live URL and loads correctly

levels.Excellent: Application is successfully deployed and fully functional. Live URL is accessible, site loads quickly, all features work in production, no console errors. Professional deployment configuration.
levels.Good: Site is deployed and accessible with minor issues. May have slight loading delays or one minor feature not working in production. Overall deployment is successful.
levels.Fair: Deployment attempted but with significant issues. Site loads but multiple features broken in production, or significant performance problems. Partial deployment success.
levels.Poor: Deployment failed or site is not accessible. URL returns errors, site doesn't load, or deployment was not attempted. No working live demo available.

scoring_guide.criterion_8_note: Criterion 8 (JavaScript Functionality) uses 10 points with each sub-feature worth 1 point
scoring_guide.decimal_explanation: Scores can include decimals (e.g., 2.5, 3.7, 8.5) when performance falls between levels. For Criterion 8, decimal scoring reflects partial completion of the 10 features.
